title: The role of applied psychology in typography
content:
[The role of applied psychology in typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043402/http:/www.plainlanguagenetwork.org/type/utbo510.htm).

_Just_ came across this. Have not checked the source yet (haven’t even finished reading it actually). How ironic that the type is hard to read.
author: Christopher Dean

comments.content: The source is [Plain Language Association](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043402/http:/www.plainlanguagenetwork.org/), but man, that thing is a train wreck!

Looks a lot more like the Palin Language Association .... which, quite obviously, doesn’t exist. (At least I hope not!)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043402im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Palin-word-salad_5232.jpg)
Thanks for keeping an eye out Christopher!

[Obscurantism](http://web.archive.org/web/20090513043402/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obscurantism).

Interesting. I’ll definitely add that to my glossary.
